t: Luke 15
The Parable of the Lost Sheep
Now*p the tax collectors and sinners were all gathering around to hear Jesus.
But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law muttered, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
Then*p Jesus told them this parable:

“Suppose*r one*r of*r you*r has*r a*r hundred*r sheep*r and*r loses*r one*r of*r them.*r Doesn’t*r he*r leave*r the*r ninety-nine*r in*r the*r open*r country*r and*r go*r after*r the*r lost*r sheep*r until*r he*r finds*r it?*r
And*r when*r he*r finds*r it,*r he*r joyfully*r puts*r it*r on*r his*r shoulders*r
and*r goes*r home.*r Then*r he*r calls*r his*r friends*r and*r neighbors*r together*r and*r says,*r ‘Rejoice*r with*r me;*r I*r have*r found*r my*r lost*r sheep.’*r

I*r tell*r you*r that*r in*r the*r same*r way*r there*r will*r be*r more*r rejoicing*r in*r heaven*r over*r one*r sinner*r who*r repents*r than*r over*r ninety-nine*r righteous*r persons*r who*r do*r not*r need*r to*r repent.*r
The Parable of the Lost Coin
“Or*rp suppose*r a*r woman*r has*r ten*r silver*r coins*r and*r loses*r one.*r Doesn’t*r she*r light*r a*r lamp,*r sweep*r the*r house*r and*r search*r carefully*r until*r she*r finds*r it?*r
And*r when*r she*r finds*r it,*r she*r calls*r her*r friends*r and*r neighbors*r together*r and*r says,*r ‘Rejoice*r with*r me;*r I*r have*r found*r my*r lost*r coin.’*r
In*r the*r same*r way,*r I*r tell*r you,*r there*r is*r rejoicing*r in*r the*r presence*r of*r the*r angels*r of*r God*r over*r one*r sinner*r who*r repents.”*r
The Parable of the Lost Son
Jesus*p continued: “There*r was*r a*r man*r who*r had*r two*r sons.*r
The*r younger*r one*r said*r to*r his*r father,*r ‘Father,*r give*r me*r my*r share*r of*r the*r estate.’*r So*r he*r divided*r his*r property*r between*r them.*r
“Not*rp long*r after*r that,*r the*r younger*r son*r got*r together*r all*r he*r had,*r set*r off*r for*r a*r distant*r country*r and*r there*r squandered*r his*r wealth*r in*r wild*r living.*r
After*r he*r had*r spent*r everything,*r there*r was*r a*r severe*r famine*r in*r that*r whole*r country,*r and*r he*r began*r to*r be*r in*r need.*r
So*r he*r went*r and*r hired*r himself*r out*r to*r a*r citizen*r of*r that*r country,*r who*r sent*r him*r to*r his*r fields*r to*r feed*r pigs.*r
He*r longed*r to*r fill*r his*r stomach*r with*r the*r pods*r that*r the*r pigs*r were*r eating,*r but*r no*r one*r gave*r him*r anything.*r
“When*rp he*r came*r to*r his*r senses,*r he*r said,*r ‘How*r many*r of*r my*r father’s*r hired*r servants*r have*r food*r to*r spare,*r and*r here*r I*r am*r starving*r to*r death!*r
I*r will*r set*r out*r and*r go*r back*r to*r my*r father*r and*r say*r to*r him:*r Father,*r I*r have*r sinned*r against*r heaven*r and*r against*r you.*r
I*r am*r no*r longer*r worthy*r to*r be*r called*r your*r son;*r make*r me*r like*r one*r of*r your*r hired*r servants.’*r

So*r he*r got*r up*r and*r went*r to*r his*r father.*r “But*rp while*r he*r was*r still*r a*r long*r way*r off,*r his*r father*r saw*r him*r and*r was*r filled*r with*r compassion*r for*r him;*r he*r ran*r to*r his*r son,*r threw*r his*r arms*r around*r him*r and*r kissed*r him.*r
“The*rp son*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Father,*r I*r have*r sinned*r against*r heaven*r and*r against*r you.*r I*r am*r no*r longer*r worthy*r to*r be*r called*r your*r son.’*r
“But*rp the*r father*r said*r to*r his*r servants,*r ‘Quick!*r Bring*r the*r best*r robe*r and*r put*r it*r on*r him.*r Put*r a*r ring*r on*r his*r finger*r and*r sandals*r on*r his*r feet.*r
Bring*r the*r fattened*r calf*r and*r kill*r it.*r Let’s*r have*r a*r feast*r and*r celebrate.*r
For*r this*r son*r of*r mine*r was*r dead*r and*r is*r alive*r again;*r he*r was*r lost*r and*r is*r found.’*r So*r they*r began*r to*r celebrate.*r
“Meanwhile,*rp the*r older*r son*r was*r in*r the*r field.*r When*r he*r came*r near*r the*r house,*r he*r heard*r music*r and*r dancing.*r
So*r he*r called*r one*r of*r the*r servants*r and*r asked*r him*r what*r was*r going*r on.*r
‘Your*r brother*r has*r come,’*r he*r replied,*r ‘and*r your*r father*r has*r killed*r the*r fattened*r calf*r because*r he*r has*r him*r back*r safe*r and*r sound.’*r
“The*rp older*r brother*r became*r angry*r and*r refused*r to*r go*r in.*r So*r his*r father*r went*r out*r and*r pleaded*r with*r him.*r

But*r he*r answered*r his*r father,*r ‘Look!*r All*r these*r years*r I’ve*r been*r slaving*r for*r you*r and*r never*r disobeyed*r your*r orders.*r Yet*r you*r never*r gave*r me*r even*r a*r young*r goat*r so*r I*r could*r celebrate*r with*r my*r friends.*r
But*r when*r this*r son*r of*r yours*r who*r has*r squandered*r your*r property*r with*r prostitutes*r comes*r home,*r you*r kill*r the*r fattened*r calf*r for*r him!’*r
“ ‘My*rp son,’*r the*r father*r said,*r ‘you*r are*r always*r with*r me,*r and*r everything*r I*r have*r is*r yours.*r
But*r we*r had*r to*r celebrate*r and*r be*r glad,*r because*r this*r brother*r of*r yours*r was*r dead*r and*r is*r alive*r again;*r he*r was*r lost*r and*r is*r found.’ ”*r
